input: Which one of the following statements about Electoral Government in India is not correct? (CDS 2015-II)

options.A: The superintendence, direction and control of elections are vested in the Election Commission of India.
options.B: There is one general electoral roll for every territorial constituency.
options.C: The Parliament has the power to make laws relating to the delimitation of constituencies.
options.D: The Supreme Court of India has the authority to scrutinize the validity of a law relating to delimitation of constituencies.

explanation: Under Article 82 of the constitution, after every census, the delimitation commission demarcates the boundary of parliamentary constituency on the basis of Delimitation Act.
